poem:
### Tenuous Threads

The air quivers,  
a taut string of breath—  
ceasefire whispers  
between weary eyes.  
Guns linger,  
like shadows at dawn,  
while hope dares to walk  
on brittle ground.  
Supple hands must weave  
frayed ends into peace,  
a delicate tapestry,  
fragile as life,  
in a landscape  
longing for gentle rain.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Israel-Gaza ceasefire deal hangs by a thread. This is what must happen for peace to last | Simon Tisdall The defiant appearance of heavily armed Hamas fighters during Sunday’s handover to the Red Cross of three Israeli hostages held in Gaza since the 7 October 2023 terrorist atrocities was a sinister reminder, if one were needed, that the ceasefire deal negotiated last week hangs by a thread – and could snap at any moment.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
